DOCNAME: CASE OF DARNELL v. THE UNITED KINGDOM
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , PERSON , who was born in DATE , has been unemployed since ORG ( " the RHA " ) terminated his employment as a consultant microbiologist and Director of ORG in GPE . This case concerns the length of time that proceedings relating to this dismissal have taken .

CARDINAL . Following administrative changes in ORG in DATE , management problems arose in many regions including the GPE RHA . As a result of differences over staff appointment procedures , in DATE a local grievance procedure was initiated against PERSON before ORG ( " the AHA " ) by ORG .
Although Dr PERSON was considered by ORG legal department to have been acting within the terms of the ORG ’s guidelines in ORG ( IS ) CARDINAL , the ORG endorsed the new appointments procedure .

CARDINAL . Following further disagreement , a formal complaint was made in DATE by the ORG to the GPE RHA alleging non - compliance with laboratory staff appointment procedures . PERSON was informed by letter of DATE that a sub - committee had been set up to deal with the ORG ’s formal complaint .

After various investigations had been carried out , a disciplinary procedure under circular ORG ( CARDINAL ) CARDINAL was instituted against Dr PERSON by the GPE RHA . By letter of DATE he was suspended from duty pending the outcome .
CARDINAL . After attempts to settle the case had failed , a panel of inquiry sat for DATE between DATE and DATE . It reported in DATE that the applicant was at fault in certain respects .

A sub - committee subsequently appointed by the GPE RHA recommended that Dr PERSON ’s employment as a consultant microbiologist be terminated . Accordingly , by letter of CARDINAL DATE from the GPE RHA , the applicant was dismissed on CARDINAL months’ notice with effect from DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed to the Secretary of ORG against his dismissal on DATE . A professional committee was appointed in accordance with paragraph CARDINAL of the Terms and ORG . The paragraph CARDINAL procedure has since been replaced by a new procedure which incorporates time - limits into the various stages of an appeal to the Secretary of ORG against dismissal .
After holding a hearing on DATE , the professional committee reported to the Secretary of ORG who , in DATE , sought further information .

CARDINAL . The Secretary of ORG directed the RHA to offer PERSON a new post in the region without managerial responsibility . In reaching this decision the Secretary of ORG had noted that the professional committee had been very critical of the handling of the case .

The RHA challenged this direction . The applicant was informed by ORG ( " the ORG " ) that in view of the unavailability of alternative employment , the case had been remitted to the Secretary of ORG who , not being bound by the professional committee ’s recommendation to allow the appeal , had decided that the termination of PERSON services in accordance with the paragraph CARDINAL procedure should be confirmed .

CARDINAL . By judicial review proceedings commenced in ORG on DATE , the applicant challenged the fairness of the procedure leading to the Secretary of ORG ’s decision . ORG granted a declaration that this decision was invalid and indicated that the Secretary of ORG should reconsider the matter . The Secretary of ORG did not appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant informed the ORG that he now sought a further paragraph CARDINAL hearing . An exchange of correspondence took place . The ORG attempted to convoke an ad hoc committee meeting , but this was cancelled as the applicant refused to accept such a compromise . On DATE , having proceeded on the basis of the written material which included further written submissions , the Secretary of ORG decided to confirm the applicant ’s dismissal .

Accordingly , by letter of DATE , the ORG informed the applicant that , on the basis of the professional committee ’s report of DATE and the written submissions made by PERSON and the GPE RHA , re - employment was not a possibility and termination of his services was effective from the date of that letter .
CARDINAL . The applicant ’s application for judicial review of the validity of the Secretary of ORG ’s direction was dismissed on DATE .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , the applicant had also sought reinstatement , re - engagement and damages for dismissal by proceedings in ORG . CARDINAL applications had been made to the ORG , the first on DATE following his dismissal in DATE and the second in DATE following the Secretary of ORG ’s initial rejection of his appeal against dismissal . These proceedings had been stayed from time to time at the applicant ’s request , pending the results of the appeal to the Secretary of ORG and the judicial review proceedings .

In DATE , the second ORG application was revived and the first was subsequently withdrawn . A pre - hearing assessment took place on DATE in which the ORG determined that a hearing could take place with no cost consequences to the applicant .

In its reserved decision of DATE , the ORG held that the dismissal of the applicant was not unfair . It had not been persuaded that the applicant had in any way been prejudiced by the time which had elapsed until a decision was finally reached . He had been paid his salary in full until DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant ’s appeal to ORG was dismissed on DATE .

CARDINAL . In DATE a separate action in the High Court claiming damages for the applicant ’s suspension from work in DATE pending the outcome of the disciplinary procedure was struck out as it disclosed no reasonable cause of action . An appeal against the striking out was dismissed in DATE .
